Node.definition: = man; ◄ son of David (דָּוִד) tribe of Judah (יְהוּדָה) ► king of Judah and Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) given the name Jedidiah (יְדִידְיָהּ) at his birth
= direct or indirect human offspring, either male or indeterminate, either biologically or through adoption
= man; ◄ son of Jesse (יִשַׁי) ► king of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל)
= supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity

= man, also known as Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and Jeshurun (יְשֻׁרוּן) including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of Isaac (יִצְחָק) and Rebekah (רִבְקָה) brother of Esau (עֵשָׂו) and ► father of twelve sons after whom the tribes of Israel were named and one daughter
literally: to know; hence: = process by which humans know what a certain experience is about by studying or living through it
= state in which humans, deities or animals have a certain level of wisdom, intelligence, or proficiency

= causative action by which deities offer primarily verbal instruction to humans, which may occasionally be accompanied by physical punishment, given as a result of misbehavior or to prevent misbehavior, ► aimed to teach the receiver (and sometimes other people as well) wisdom and good behavior

Node.gloss: to consider|to pay heed|to perceive|to realize|to understand|to distinguish
Node.definition: = process by which someone gains knowledge and understanding by observing carefully in order to see through the outward appearance of things and grasp their essence
= words spoken by humans and deities; often remembered and recorded
= state whereby someone has the ability to see through the outward appearance of things and grasp their essence

= causative action by which deities offer primarily verbal instruction to humans, which may occasionally be accompanied by physical punishment, given as a result of misbehavior or to prevent misbehavior, ► aimed to teach the receiver (and sometimes other people as well) wisdom and good behavior

Node.gloss: to be wise|to have understanding|to be skilled
Node.definition: = state in which humans have the ability to understand things

= pattern of behavior of humans or deities that is in accordance to the requirements of the divine law and generally aimed at establishing or restoring this pattern as a standard, which in certain cases requires a victory over evil and results in prosperity and happiness
= practices that conform to the laws of God
literally: smoothness; hence: = state in which an event is morally and ethically right
= person who is easily influenced by other people, ideas or one's own passions; ◄ because of his/her lack of wisdom and experience

= state in which someone is able to manipulate difficult circumstances in such a way that the outcome is favorable to the planner; ≈ sometimes used in a positive sense, but also used in a negative sense
literally: knowing; hence: = a collection of information stored and processed in someone's mind that gives that person the ability to analyse, discern, make decisions and act accordingly
= human power or ability to devise a plan or strategy to accomplish a certain goal
= state in which humans, deities or animals have a certain level of wisdom, intelligence, or proficiency
literally: to add; hence: = process by which a certain quality of humans increases in intensity, either in actual fact or in the eyes of others

= causative action by which humans and deities give verbal instruction to other humans, and by which the focus is on the communication of the message rather than the content of the message; ≈ often connoting persuasive or eloquent speech

Node.gloss: to be intelligent|to be discerning|to have insight|to be an expert
Node.definition: = state in which someone has the ability to see through the outward appearance of things and grasp their essence
literally: to acquire; hence: = action by which humans acquire a certain quality

Node.gloss: to consider|to pay heed|to perceive|to realize|to understand|to distinguish
Node.definition: = process by which someone gains knowledge and understanding by observing carefully in order to see through the outward appearance of things and grasp their essence
= state in which humans, deities or animals have a certain level of wisdom, intelligence, or proficiency
= action by which humans or deities utter words that are often compacted and well formulated and that require wisdom to be understood
= state in which humans experience fear
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= point in time at which an event starts happening
literally: knowing; hence: = a collection of information stored and processed in someone's mind that gives that person the ability to analyse, discern, make decisions and act accordingly
= state in which humans, deities or animals have a certain level of wisdom, intelligence, or proficiency

= causative action by which deities offer primarily verbal instruction to humans, which may occasionally be accompanied by physical punishment, given as a result of misbehavior or to prevent misbehavior, ► aimed to teach the receiver (and sometimes other people as well) wisdom and good behavior
= pertaining to being foolish, which manifests itself in a lack of fear of God, unwillingness to listen to advice, much talking, and being unable to conceal one's emotions
= state in which someone considers someone or something else unworthy of attention or respect, and shows that by his/her actions
= title used to address a person (male if in singular) who is regarded with some degree of affection, ◄ as if he were the speaker's child

= causative action by which deities offer primarily verbal instruction to humans, which may occasionally be accompanied by physical punishment, given as a result of misbehavior or to prevent misbehavior, ► aimed to teach the receiver (and sometimes other people as well) wisdom and good behavior
= direct male progenitor; ► who normally provides protection, care, instruction, and discipline; ≈ is usually regarded with respect and associated with wisdom, security, and comfort
= causative action by which humans or deities offer instruction to (other) humans, ► aimed to teach the recipients wisdom and good behavior
= direct female progenitor; ≈ associated with affection and loyalty; often extended figuratively to refer to other objects that are regarded as feminine
possible meaning: = flowers or leaves woven together into a ring; ► worn on one's head; ≈ associated with honor and beauty
= state in which someone or something is physically attractive; ► which may bring about a favorable attitude in others

= upper part of the human body, or the front or upper part of the body of an animal, typically separated from the rest of the body by a neck, and containing the brain, mouth, and sense organs; ≈ associated with the entire person, that person's life, and that person's responsibilities
= ornament worn around the neck of people and animals
= the front part of the neck, ► around which ornaments can be placed; ≈ only used in wisdom literature
= title used to address a person (male if in singular) who is regarded with some degree of affection, ◄ as if he were the speaker's child
= marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place

Node.gloss: to lure|to allure|to entice|to coax|to persuade|to seduce|to flatter|to trick|to deceive
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans or deities provoke in (other) humans the will or desire to do something
= pattern of actions by which humans commit specified or implied offenses, ► resulting in a state of guilt which may require atonement, restitution, and retribution
= state in which someone is willing to do something
= marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= action by which humans, deities, or animals move forward, usually towards a specific destination
particle linking two entities and denoting that X and Y function as one single entity in the proposition in focus

Node.gloss: to lie in wait|to lay an ambush|to lurk
Node.definition: = to go to a location where one will not be readily seen by others; ► and wait there for an opportunity to seize or attack someone or do something else that is supposed to be done when nobody else can witness it
= causative action by which humans kill other humans in a violent way, usually involving the shedding of blood, which brings guilt upon the people committing these acts

Node.gloss: to lurk|to lie in wait|to ambush
Node.definition: = action by which humans hide themselves ► in order to attack another person
= state in which humans are not held responsible for actions committed in the past or for future commitments
= action by which someone performs an event without any argument, cause, or reason that could possibly explain or justify it
= action by which humans or animals cause food to pass down from their mouth to their esophagus; ≈ often used figuratively to denote destruction and death

= abode of the dead, a place of darkness and silence, located deep in the earth and inaccessible, where there is neither compassion nor wisdom; ≈ regarded as a place that is never satisfied; often personified; going there before one's time is considered a punishment

= state in which humans and deities are alive and well, ◄ which, for humans, requires the presence of air to breathe and food to eat; ≈ life is regarded as more than a mere physical condition; in many cases it includes health, strength, and some degree of prosperity

Node.gloss: to go down (to the netherworld)|to die
Node.definition: literally: to go down (to the netherworld, death, the pit, the dust, silence, etc.); hence: = process by which humans die and descend into the world of the dead
= world of the dead, ◄ described as a pit, deep in the ground
= a large quantity of valuable resources, ownership of which affects the way people think and live
= state in which humans or objects are considered valuable and desirable
= process by which humans or objects come upon (other) humans or objects without searching
= causative action by which someone causes a certain location, container, or surface to be filled or covered with so many objects that little or no space is left

= construction surrounded by walls and covered with a roof; ◄ normally made of stones, wood, or clay; ► to be used as living quarters, for storage, as a prison, as a sanctuary, etc.; sometimes used to denote a smaller part of a large construction
= the process of arriving at a decision based on casting the lot
literally: to let lots fall; hence: = causative action by which humans throw lots in order to select individuals or groups from among a large group
= receptacle, ◄ made of leather or cloth, ► used to carry possessions, including money
= state in which a countable entity is one in number
= title used to address a person (male if in singular) who is regarded with some degree of affection, ◄ as if he were the speaker's child
= action by which humans, deities, or animals move forward, usually towards a specific destination
literally: road; hence: = pattern of behavior, with a primary focus on moral and ethical behavior, ◄ understood as a journey through life
particle linking two entities and denoting that X and Y function as one single entity in the proposition in focus
literally: foot, here used metonymically to denote the entire person or animal owning it; hence: = a human being or animal with focus on the activities for which they use their feet
literally: foot, here used metonymically to denote the entire person or animal owning it; hence: = a human being or animal with focus on the activities for which they use their feet
= state in which an event is morally and/or ethically wrong
= action by which humans or deities act without delay
literally: to pour out blood; hence: = to wound or kill an animate being
= causative action by which humans kill other humans in a violent way, usually involving the shedding of blood, which brings guilt upon the people committing these acts
= action by which someone performs an event without purpose and bound to achieve nothing
= causative action by which a net is opened out so as to be able to cover the largest possible area
= net of unknown size and shape; ► used for hunting birds and other animals, and also for fishing; ≈ associated with aggression and control

= one of two parts of the body of humans and animals that is used to see things, after which the observed information is stored and processed in the mind; sparkling when the body is healthy and strong, but dim when weak or sick; the eyes also play a significant role in determining whether a person is considered beautiful or not; eyes can reflect both an attitude of compassion and a sentiment of malice; ≈ high eyes are associated with pride, whereas lowly eyes are connected with humility; a good eye is associated with generosity, whereas an evil eye denotes stinginess; winking the eye is associated with underhanded practices
= animal with certain bodily features, such as wings or horns
= part of body; ◄ of bird, insect, celestial creature; ► used for flying but also to give protection
= causative action by which humans kill other humans in a violent way, usually involving the shedding of blood, which brings guilt upon the people committing these acts

Node.gloss: to lie in wait|to lay an ambush|to lurk
Node.definition: = to go to a location where one will not be readily seen by others; ► and wait there for an opportunity to seize or attack someone or do something else that is supposed to be done when nobody else can witness it

Node.gloss: to lurk|to lie in wait|to ambush
Node.definition: = action by which humans hide themselves ► in order to attack another person

literally: throat, as the part of the body that contains the passage ways for blood, air, and food; hence: = the life principle that animates both humans and animals, turns them into breathing living beings, and functions as the center of their personality, mind, physical and non physical desires, courage, emotions, and affections; it is believed to reside in the blood
= a pattern of behavior, with a primary focus on moral and ethical behavior, ◄ understood as a journey through life
= pattern of actions by which someone makes an effort to get personal gain; ≈ with a negative connotation, of unjust gain
= possessions accumulated through advantageous transactions, in which part of the income can be kept for oneself, mostly achieved in an unjust way

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix

literally: throat, as the part of the body that contains the passage ways for blood, air, and food; hence: = the life principle that animates both humans and animals, turns them into breathing living beings, and functions as the center of their personality, mind, physical and non physical desires, courage, emotions, and affections; it is believed to reside in the blood
= person exercising authority over people, animals, or inanimate objects in the role of owner, ruler, or husband
= state in which humans, deities or animals have a certain level of wisdom, intelligence, or proficiency
= area outside of living quarters; ► used as thoroughfare
= central part of a city where people meet and where civic and commercial activities take place, usually at the intersection of streets and roads
literally: head; hence: = the topmost part of a vertically oriented object, such as a mountain, and the principal part of an horizontally oriented object, such as a street or a bed
= state in which the traffic in streets makes much noise
= action by which humans or deities speak with a loud voice, often to draw attention to themselves or to their situation and expecting someone to respond in one way or another
= the opening by which a person enters or exits an enclosed space, such as a house, a tent, a temple, or a larger area like a city; it can also be used figuratively to denote the mouth

= relatively large and permanent population center, usually surrounded by a wall and surrounded by a number of dependent villages (חָצֵר) settlements (בַּת) and pasturelands (מִגְרָשׁ) ≈ associated with strength and security
= words spoken by humans and deities; often remembered and recorded
= action by which humans refer to a particular object when speaking
particle linking an event to a point in time; = relation indicating that event X ends at point in time Y

= reference to an unknown point in time; ► normally used with the purpose of finding out which point in time is intended; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that this point of time may never arrive
= state in which humans or deities experience a feeling of affection for a person, an object, or a practice
= person who is easily influenced by other people, ideas or one's own passions; ◄ because of his/her lack of wisdom and experience
= person who is easily influenced by other people, ideas or one's own passions; ◄ because of his/her lack of wisdom and experience
= someone who shows contempt for other people and ideas
= action by which someone shows contempt for people and ideas
= process by which humans or deities experience an eager desire for a person or object

= state of absence of wisdom, which manifests itself in excessive anger, talking too rashly and too much, sinful behavior, and laziness, ► and results in poverty, shame, punishment, and trouble and grief for other people; ≈ foolishness is thought to reside in a person's heart (לֵב) the behavior and treatment of fools is often compared to that of animals
= state in which humans or deities experience hostility towards a person, an object, or a practice
literally: knowing; hence: = a collection of information stored and processed in someone's mind that gives that person the ability to analyse, discern, make decisions and act accordingly
literally: to turn (back) to (an activity); hence: = action by which humans engage in an activity; in most cases this is an activity in which they were engaged before
= action by which someone speaks in order to defend oneself or to accuse someone else; sometimes accompanied by actions

Node.gloss: (to cause) to bubble up > to pour out
Node.definition: literally: to cause to bubble up (words); hence: = action by which humans utter many words
= inner person of a human or celestial being, associated with emotions, such as joy, grief, worry, courage, anger, willingness, etc.

Node.gloss: to make known|to show|to inform|to tell|to teach
Node.definition: = causative process by which humans or deities cause (other) humans to acquire information about (other) humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= a linker introducing a proposition denoting the reason for what precedes
= action by which humans or deities speak with a loud voice, often to draw attention to themselves or to their situation and expecting someone to respond in one way or another
= state in which humans and deities are unwilling to assent to a suggestion or proposal

Node.gloss: to stretch out (part of one's body)
Node.definition: literally: to stretch out (one's hand or neck); hence: = action by which humans straighten part of their body, such as their hands or necks

= the lower part of the upper limb of the human body, which in some contexts may include the full arm, ► apart from basic human activities such as holding, giving and taking, working, beating, also used in rituals around blessings, oaths, and prayer; ≈ used figuratively in expressions involving strength, control, responsibility, punishment; ≈ possibly used as a euphemism for the male genitals

Node.gloss: there is not|it is not|it does not
Node.definition: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non existant
= action by which humans or deities pay close attention in order to be able to hear what (other) humans might be saying, or to pick up other sounds and react to if needed
= action by which someone speaks in order to defend oneself or to accuse someone else; sometimes accompanied by actions
= state in which someone is favorably disposed towards an event
= marker pointing out that the information that follows represents the logical consequence of what has been stated before
= referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse
= extremely difficult circumstances ► resulting in grief, poverty, sickness, and/or death
literally: to laugh (at someone); hence: = action by which humans or deities express their lack of respect for (other) humans, often accompanied by laughter
only used in poetry; = action by which humans or deities express their disdain of others with words, sounds and/or gestures
= process by which someone experiences extreme fear, ► which may be accompanied by visible symptoms such as trembling
literally: destruction; hence: = a strong wind that destroys everything in its way
= process by which someone experiences extreme fear, ► which may be accompanied by visible symptoms such as trembling
= extremely difficult circumstances ► resulting in grief, poverty, sickness, and/or death
= process by which a strong wind blows, ► causing destruction and inspiring fear; ≈ often associated with the appearance and intervention of God and used as a symbol of warfare and hardship
literally: to come; hence: = process by which things happen to someone ◄ as if it were a person coming to visit
= a process by which humans go through extremely difficult circumstances, resulting in severe anxiety, ◄ as if one were confined to a narrow and cramped space from which there is no escape
= state in which humans experience distress
= referent pointing to a specific point in time, either in the past or the future
= action by which humans or deities speak with a loud voice, often to draw attention to themselves or to their situation and expecting someone to respond in one way or another
= action in which humans or deities respond to a question or situation, either by words or by actions
= process by which humans or animals discover the person, animal, object or location they were looking for
= state in which humans or deities experience hostility towards a person, an object, or a practice
literally: knowing; hence: = a collection of information stored and processed in someone's mind that gives that person the ability to analyse, discern, make decisions and act accordingly
= state in which humans experience fear
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= action by which someone makes a selection among several options, which include humans, divine beings, animals, other objects, or events
= state in which someone is favorably disposed towards an event
= state in which humans or deities are unwilling to engage in any way with (other) humans or deities, or with other objects and events, often caused by pride and contempt
= action by which someone speaks in order to defend oneself or to accuse someone else; sometimes accompanied by actions

Node.gloss: to eat the fruits > to bear the consequences
Node.definition: literally: to eat the fruits (of something); hence: = action by which someone accepts the consequences of an attitude or way of life ◄ as if they were the fruits of a tree; ≈ this expression can have both a positive or a negative sense
= the resulting effect of one's act or speech or decision
literally: road; hence: = pattern of behavior, with a primary focus on moral and ethical behavior, ◄ understood as a journey through life
= action by which humans exercise their minds to determine how they are going to achieve a particular purpose
= process by which someone's desire for food is fulfilled
= process by which people turning away from someone they had pledged to serve
= person who is easily influenced by other people, ideas or one's own passions; ◄ because of his/her lack of wisdom and experience
= causative action by which someone takes the life of a person, animal, or plant in a violent way

= state of absence of wisdom, which manifests itself in excessive anger, talking too rashly and too much, sinful behavior, and laziness, ► and results in poverty, shame, punishment, and trouble and grief for other people; ≈ foolishness is thought to reside in a person's heart (לֵב) the behavior and treatment of fools is often compared to that of animals

= causative action by which humans or deities remove (other) humans or objects from existence; ◄ by (a usually unnatural) death, aggression, hardship, disaster, destruction, or direct divine intervention; ► often as punishment
= state in which humans live with confidence and without fear; ≈ often regarded as carelessness, especially when there is no mention of trust in YHWH

Node.gloss: to be at ease|to be secure
Node.definition: = state in which humans live a peaceful life and have nothing to fear
= process by which someone experiences extreme fear, ► which may be accompanied by visible symptoms such as trembling
= state of hardship or difficulty in a circumstance, sometimes as the consequence of wicked behavior
